channel.title: How do i add objects\move them
channel.description: in gangscape V5 for practice in java, i am trying to move everything into a different location, therefor when i make my own server, i will know how to do all of the basics, so this is one of the things i need to know, please somebody help me. thanks!

item.title: How do i add objects\move them
item.dc:creator: @x_rush_x x rush x
item.description:
@x_rush_x wrote:

search in client.java for:

public void Deleteobjects() {

then ull see something on the lines of this.

public void Deleteobjects() { deletethatobject(3238, 3435); //delete bench deletethatobject(3255, 3432); //delete Table deletethatobject(3255, 3434); //delete Table deletethatobject(3255, 3431); //delete Stool deletethatobject(3255, 3432); //delete Stool deletethatobject(3256, 3431); //delete Stool deletethatobject(3257, 3433); //delete Stool deletethatobject(3251, 3431); //delete Stool deletethatobject(3092, 3488); //delete bank table deletethatobject(3095, 3498); //delete bank table deletethatobject(3090, 3494); //delete chair deletethatobject(3090, 3496); //delete chair deletethatobject(3092, 3496); //delete chair deletethatobject(3095, 3499); //delete chair deletethatobject(3091, 3495); //delete table deletethatobject(3259, 3437); //delete dummy deletethatobject(3257, 3437); //delete dummy deletethatobject(3255, 3437); //delete dummy deletethatobject(3250, 3436); //delete dummy deletethatobject(3250, 3438); //delete dummy deletethatobject(3250, 3431); //delete hay bales deletethatobject(3249, 3432); //delete hay bales deletethatobject(3253, 3431); //door deletethatobject(3249, 3435); //door }

EXAPLE

deletethatobject(3249, 3435); //door
x y name

x= x cord of were the object is

y= y cord of were the object is

name= name of the object

to find out the cords of the object right click it you will see this.

#### (####,####)

item id x y

hope this helps u[br][size=1]Posted on: July 01, 2007, 05:45:56 PM[/size][hr]oh and i forgot

just add onto it at the bottum b4 the last }

item.title: How do i add objects\move them
item.dc:creator: @x_rush_x x rush x
item.description:
@x_rush_x wrote:

ok open client.jave and search public void NewObjects() {

you will see this.

public void NewObjects() { AddGlobalObject(3004, 3383, 2469, 0, 10);//portal AddGlobalObject(3090, 3494, 2513, 1, 10);//range target AddGlobalObject(3090, 3495, 2513, 1, 10);//range target AddGlobalObject(3090, 3496, 2513, 1, 10);//range target AddGlobalObject(3098, 3495, 381, -2, 10);//bookcase AddGlobalObject(3098, 3497, 381, -2, 10);//bookcase AddGlobalObject(2606, 3163, 5162, -3, 10); // Fighter Torso Minigame AddGlobalObject(2911, 3614, 4090, -3, 10);//flaming fire alter AddGlobalObject(2911, 3611, 2469, 0, 10);//portal AddGlobalObject(2913, 3609, 2153, 0, 10);//fire ob AddGlobalObject(2909, 3612, 2153, 0, 10);//fire ob AddGlobalObject(2917, 3607, 2153, 0, 10);//fire ob AddGlobalObject(2904, 3615, 2153, 0, 10);//fire ob AddGlobalObject(2915, 3615, 2153, 0, 10);//fire ob AddGlobalObject(2920, 3612, 2153, 0, 10);//fire ob AddGlobalObject(2908, 3608, 2153, 0, 10);//fire ob AddGlobalObject(2902, 3600, 2153, 0, 10);//fire ob AddGlobalObject(2911, 3604, 2153, 0, 10);//fire ob AddGlobalObject(2909, 3612, 2153, 0, 10);//fire ob AddGlobalObject(2910, 3619, 2153, 0, 10);//fire ob AddGlobalObject(3281, 2765, 2107, 0, 10);//rune rock in mine -- mining AddGlobalObject(3285, 2767, 2091, 0, 10);//copper rock in mine -- mining AddGlobalObject(3285, 2768, 2091, 0, 10);//copper rock in mine -- mining AddGlobalObject(3277, 2767, 2094, 0, 10);//tin rock in mine -- mining AddGlobalObject(3277, 2768, 2094, 0, 10);//tin rock in mine -- mining AddGlobalObject(3285, 2770, 2092, 0, 10);//iron rock in mine -- mining AddGlobalObject(3285, 2771, 2092, 0, 10);//iron rock in mine -- mining AddGlobalObject(3277, 2770, 2097, 0, 10);//coal rock in mine -- mining AddGlobalObject(3277, 2771, 2097, 0, 10);//coal rock in mine -- mining AddGlobalObject(3285, 2773, 2102, 0, 10);//mith rock in mine -- mining AddGlobalObject(3285, 2774, 2102, 0, 10);//mith rock in mine -- mining AddGlobalObject(3277, 2773, 2105, 0, 10);//addy rock in mine -- mining AddGlobalObject(3277, 2774, 2105, 0, 10);//addy rock in mine -- mining AddGlobalObject(3095, 3499, 2728, -1, 10);//range AddGlobalObject(3094, 3488, 823, -3, 10);//dummy AddGlobalObject(3092, 3488, 411, -2, 10);//alter AddGlobalObject(3091, 3488, 823, -3, 10);//dummy AddGlobalObject(3091, 3493, 4150, 1, 10);//portal AddGlobalObject(3091, 3497, 4150, 1, 10);//partal AddGlobalObject(3095, 3494, 2474, 1, 10);//portal AddGlobalObject(3094, 3493, 2474, 1, 10);//portal

for the last one as an example i will use portal i added that btw,

AddGlobalObject(3094, 3493, 2474, 1, 10);//portal
x y id way leave 10

x = x cordinate

y = y cordinate

id = object id

way = way its facing (north,west,east,south)

10 = just leeave it at 10

hope this helps

item.title: How do i add objects\move them
item.dc:creator: @Wildcat_240 Wildcat_240
item.description:
@Wildcat_240 wrote:

in client.java look for globalobjects example:

 makeGlobalObject(XCOORD, YCOORD, ITEMID, FACE(Direction), 10);//Ancients Altar

the 10 means the object is on the ground, so just keep it as that
